text: Ponerorchis capitata (synonym Amitostigma capitatum) is a species of plant in the family Orchidaceae. It is endemic to China, known only from Sichuan and Hubei.Flora of China v 25 p 128, 头序无柱兰 tou xu wu zhu lan, Amitostigma capitatumChina Plant Specialist Group. 2004. Amitostigma capitatum. The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species 2004. Downloaded on 10 September 2015. It produces white flowers.Amitostigma capitatum. Flora of China. ==Taxonomy== The species was first described in 1936 by Tsin Tang and Fa Tsuan Wang, as Amitostigma capitatum. A molecular phylogenetic study in 2014 found that species of Amitostigma, Neottianthe and Ponerorchis were mixed together in a single clade, making none of the three genera monophyletic as then circumscribed. Amitostigma and Neottianthe were subsumed into Ponerorchis, with this species becoming Ponerorchis capitata. == References == Category:Endemic orchids of China capitata Category:Endangered plants Category:Flora of Sichuan Category:Flora of Hubei Category:Plants described in 1936 Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Ponerorchis capitata
